decks.notes: This aggro Rakdos deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly by using cards like Bloodghast and Lightning Skelemental. The deck also uses graveyard recursion with cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Unearth to maintain a steady stream of threats. Leyline of Combustion punishes opponents for targeting your creatures, while Flare of Malice and Corrupted Conviction provide additional reach and removal. The deck also utilizes Village Rites and Detective's Phoenix for card draw and value. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats and burn spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards that tax their resources. By constantly applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to control the board and outpace the opponent to secure a quick victory. The combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, along with disruptive spells like Consign to Memory and Quantum Riddler, creates a versatile and dynamic strategy that can overwhelm opponents in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. By including cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to control the board while dealing direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck benefits from card draw and selection with Preordain and Expressive Iteration to maintain a constant stream of threats. With a mix of burn spells and fast creatures, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to be fast and aggressive, utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes multiple spells and abilities that can pump up the creatures or deal direct damage, allowing for quick victories by overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage and help ensure a consistent draw of threats.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game. It also utilizes powerful removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to keep the opponent's board in check. The inclusion of unique cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker add extra versatility and unpredictability to the deck, making it a strong and versatile Aggro - Death And Taxes archetype in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Salvage Titan to recur artifacts and generate value, combined with powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to build a board presence quickly and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The inclusion of Tormod's Crypt and Claws of Gix also provide disruption and utility against graveyard strategies and problematic permanents. Overall, the deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and resource management to outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, aiming to control the board with removal spells while applying pressure with efficient threats. The deck utilizes creatures with powerful abilities like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk, while also running disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure on the board, forcing them to react to your plays and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive mono black creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly. By playing efficient threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Nethergoyf, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily advancing its own board presence. With the addition of cards like Pithing Needle and Emperor of Bones, the deck can further disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain a strong aggressive stance throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with key creatures and then bringing them back into play using reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to efficiently fill the graveyard, the deck can bring out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones early in the game. The combination of reanimation spells, graveyard manipulation, and powerful creatures forms the core strategy of this Combo - Reanimator deck, allowing it to overwhelm opponents with unexpected threats and powerful synergies.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to go wide with creatures like Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to finish off the opponent. Blood Moon is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Arena of Glory provides additional card draw and life gain. The deck aims to play fast and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then use reanimation spells such as "Unearth" and "Persist" to bring them back onto the battlefield. This combo-focused strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures like "Archon of Cruelty" and disrupt their game plan with cards like "Thoughtseize" and "Spell Pierce". Utilizing cards like "Psychic Frog" and "Harbinger of the Seas" adds control elements to the deck, creating a versatile and powerful reanimator combo archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using the Broodscale Bloodchief to create a powerful combo with cards like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Malevolent Rumble. The deck also includes cards like Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to support the combo's strategy. By utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. With the addition of Emrakul, the Promised End and other powerful creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through its unique combo interactions.

The main strategy of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using cheap, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Fiery Islet, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Surgical Extraction. By combining aggressive creatures with burn and disruption spells, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and secure a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on powerful early aggression with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by a mix of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and creatures like Guide of Souls. The deck also includes versatile cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm for added flexibility in combat situations. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast creatures and direct damage, while also being able to protect its board with cards like Voice of Victory and Elegant Parlor against removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to control the board through efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, while also using disruptive cards such as Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler. The creatures in the deck, such as Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk, help to maintain board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Overall, the strategy focuses on a combination of disruption and aggression to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider along with Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to quickly assemble the combo pieces and bring out powerful creatures such as Ghalta, Griselbrand, and Atraxa. The deck also includes several counterspells like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo, as well as cards like Nourishing Shoal and Consign to Memory to gain life and deal with threats. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and disruptive spells.
